edu.jsu.mcis

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jsu.mcis.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows the user to add each argument and enter data values into the command line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parser()
      Creates the argument list and the optional arguments list as new Array Lists.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parser

        public Parser()
        Creates the argument list and the optional arguments list as new Array Lists.
        An example of an optional argument would be -help which would display a help message showing help information.

      • getOptionalValue

        public java.lang.String getOptionalValue(java.lang.String arg)
        Loops through the optional argument list and gets the value from each optional argument in the optional argument list. Throws an exception if no value is assigned to an optional argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - the optional argument
        Returns:
        returns the value for each optional argument.

      • setArgumentDescription

        public void setArgumentDescription(java.lang.String arg,
                                   java.lang.String description)
        Sets the description of the arguments in the optional argument list.
        Parameters:
        arg - the argument.
        description - the description of the argument.
        For example, an argument named "height" might have the description "The height of the box."
